intro: Hybanthus austrocaledonicus, commonly known as the New Caledonian hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
